metadata.title: CVE-2016-2328 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
libswscale/swscale_unscaled.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.6 does not validatecertain height values, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds array read access) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact via a crafted .cine file, related to thebayer_to_rgb24_wrapper and bayer_to_yv12_wrapper functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2328` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu1').
